comments:
While developing a JAVA application I opened a file which made Eclipse crash
with the "No more handles" error.  

Unfortunately this evil file was added to the workspace resulting in Eclipse
crashing every time I tried to start it.  

I took a couple of hours to find the right file
(.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.ui.workbench\workbench.xml) to hand edit to
remove the file.  After this Eclipse worked again.

The error log is :

Created an attachment (id=14486)
The evil file that made Eclipse crash

Stefan, I'm assigning this to you but I suspect the fast view frames are red
herrings...

I tried the following:

1. Created a new workspace with 1 project.
2. Copied "levels.cav" into the workspace
3. Opened the file by double-clicking on it (it opened in the text editor)
4. Restarted Eclipse

Everything worked okay. I suspect your system may have just been low on
resources at the time.

Closing as WORKSFORME. Please reopen if you have any additional information to
help me reproduce this.
